title: Offerings for the Tabernacle
summary: Exodus 35 begins with a command to keep the Sabbath, then describes how the Israelites bring voluntary offerings for the tabernacle. Skilled workers begin the work, led by Bezalel and Oholiab.

faq.question: How did the people respond to the call for offerings?
faq.answer: Everyone whose heart was willing brought materials and gifts for the tabernacle.

faq.question: Who were the main craftsmen again?
faq.answer: Bezalel and Oholiab, empowered by God with skill and understanding.
